headline: Why Apple's App Store restrictions won't 'change the game'
summary: Apple (AAPL) lost a legal battle to Epic Games (EPGA.PVT), as the judge's ruling could mean tighter restrictions for Apple with regards to the App Store and in-app purchases. TechRadar editor at large Lance Ulanoff joins Market Domination Overtime to explain why most users and developers are still sticking with Apple. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: Microsoft Beats Apple to Become Largest U.S. Company by Market Cap
summary: Microsoft stock’s jump following a strong earnings report for its third fiscal quarter helped push the company past Apple to become the largest in the U.S. by market capitalization on Friday.  Microsoft now has a market cap of $3.24 trillion, beating Apple’s $3.07 trillion.  The software company gained $322.8 billion in market cap this week, while Apple lost $58.7 billion.

headline: Apple CEO Tim Cook Warns Of $900 Million Tariff Impact In June Quarter, Expects Majority Of iPhones Sold In US To Be Made In India
summary: On Thursday, during Apple Inc.'s (NASDAQ:AAPL) fiscal second-quarter earnings call, CEO Tim Cook said that the tech giant expects a $900 million cost impact in the June quarter due to tariffs. What Happened: "For the June [quarter], we do expect the majority of iPhones sold in the U.S. will have India as their country of origin," Cook said. headline: Stock Market Today: Dow Jones Gains More Than 500 Points; Spotify Hits A Buy Point (Live Coverage)
summary: Stocks posted another day of strong gains Friday, fueled by news of potential progress toward the U.S. and China mending trade relations.  Indexes shrugged off an earnings sell-off for Apple and focused instead on a better-than-expected April jobs report on the stock market today.  The indexes peaked after The Wall Street Journal reported China is considering a fentanyl offer to the U.S. to start trade talks.

summary: Shares of iPhone and iPad maker Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) fell 4.1% in the morning session after the company reported mixed first-quarter 2025 (fiscal Q2) results, which narrowly topped analysts' revenue expectations, amid tariff concerns. CEO Tim Cook stated during the earnings call that anticipated tariffs could cost the company around $900 million in the current quarter (about 1% of total revenue). headline: Apple partnering with startup Anthropic on AI-powered coding platform, Bloomberg News reports
summary: "Vibe coding" refers to a programming method where AI agents generate code, a concept gaining popularity in the AI landscape.  The new AI coding system is an updated version of Apple's programming software, Xcode, and will integrate Anthropic's Claude Sonnet AI model, the report said.

headline: The Dow jumps 450 points as a strong jobs report has Trump calling for interest rate cuts again
summary: U.S. stocks opened higher Friday morning following a better than expected April jobs report. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 450 points, or 1.1%. The S&P 500 also gained 1% to extend its recent winning streak, and the Nasdaq added 0.9% following a spate of Big Tech earnings this week.

headline: Jobs report, China trade, Apple & Amazon earnings: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are rallying behind the April jobs report's employment data, which saw the US economy outdo economists' forecasts and add 177,000 non-farm payroll jobs. Chinese officials are reportedly pondering trade negotiations with the US. Amazon stock (AMZN) is slightly up in Friday pre-market trading and Apple stock (AAPL) is down after the tech giants reported earnings yesterday. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Spotify's US app update gets Apple approval after court ruling
summary: Shares of Spotify were up 6% in morning trading.  The Swedish streaming giant, along with several other tech firms, has been at loggerheads with Apple over its App Store policies, which require developers to pay a commission on in-app purchases, including subscriptions.  "After nearly a decade, this will finally allow us to freely show clear pricing information and links to purchase, fostering transparency and choice for U.S. consumers," Spotify spokesperson Jeanne Moran said in an email.

raw.headline: Spotify's US app update gets Apple approval after court ruling
raw.summary: Shares of Spotify were up 6% in morning trading.  The Swedish streaming giant, along with several other tech firms, has been at loggerheads with Apple over its App Store policies, which require developers to pay a commission on in-app purchases, including subscriptions.  "After nearly a decade, this will finally allow us to freely show clear pricing information and links to purchase, fostering transparency and choice for U.S. consumers," Spotify spokesperson Jeanne Moran said in an email.

headline: Apple Stock Drops. Why a $900 Million Tariff Hit Could Be Just the Start.
summary: Apple  stock was falling early on Friday after the company put a number on its financial hit from President Donald Trump’s tariffs.  While a plan to build more iPhones in India should help it escape the worst of the levies, Wall Street is still nervous about what comes next.  CEO Tim Cook told analysts that shipping devices sold in the U.S. from India and Vietnam, rather than China, would add about $900 million to the company’s costs for the June quarter in the company’s earnings call on Thursday.

raw.headline: Apple Stock Drops. Why a $900 Million Tariff Hit Could Be Just the Start.

CEO Tim Cook told analysts that shipping devices sold in the U.S. from India and Vietnam, rather than China, would add about $900 million to the company’s costs for the June quarter in the company’s earnings call on Thursday.

raw.summary: Apple (AAPL) says the March quarter saw limited tariff impact, but costs could rise to $900 million in the June quarter if rates hold steady. Bob O'Donnell, president of TECHnalysis Research, joins Market Domination Overtime to discuss the tariff impact and Apple's supply chain shifts. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.
